intro: Sarcocampsa, commonly known as the "buttercup" or "false buttercup," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often yellow or orange flowers with prominent sepals that resemble petals. The plants typically have basal leaves that are deeply lobed or divided, and they often grow in moist, shaded environments. Sarcocampsa species are found primarily in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are often considered ornamental due to their striking floral displays.
